A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
I sat through TLJ on opening night with some friends and family\, and our consensus at the end was "we loved it" it was like a wow moment. Now that I have had time to digest the movie\, I am of the opinion that it was fresh\, it went in new directions. Ryan took chances with the script and they paid off. He refused to make a "you must follow the fans expectation" movie. instead RJ delivered a truly remarkable film (yes there were still little issues\, but none that override the movie as a whole).  The main issue that others seem to  have with the movie\, is the portrayal of Luke\, he is not what they were expecting\, and as such their whole disdain for the movie is based on this one element\, so unfortunately a lot of reviews are severely fan biased (you know the people "I'm a true star wars fan so therefore I'm right" or "Why didn't they make my star wars".

In time this episode will I believe become a Star Wars classic\, and that's due to taking the hard core star wars fan out of their safe little comfort zone and going in new directions. It allows for the franchise to grow and to continue to go in new directions\, which as a fan is what we need.  So I say watch the movie\, do not have preconceived ideas\, and you will love the movie too.


May the Force Be With You
